articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC have booted out an Atletico Madrid bid for Matt O’Riley, as CQN predicted yesterday. Boss Brendan Rodgers confirmed the champions had rejected an offer for the midfielder and insisted the Danish international was going NOWHERE in this transfer window. It was reported the Spanish giants wanted the 23-year-old playmaker on an original loan move with [...]
articles.title: NO DEAL O’RILEY: ‘HE WON’T BE GOING ANYWHERE,’ INSISTS RODGERS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC’S £5million misfit striker Albian Ajeti has been given the boot from Turkish club Gaziantep FK – after only FOUR months! The Swiss dud signed a one-year deal with a 12-month option as he quit the Hoops on a cut-price £500,000 in September. However, Ajeti, who cost the Parkhead side TEN times that amount when [...]
articles.title: CELTIC’S £5m MISFIT AXED

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Since a substantial investment in 2021, Atletico Madrid have been more reserved in the transfer market.  This season, they concluded on Antoine Griezmann for €20m, the same sum their paid for Nahuel Molina a year earlier, but those two aside, the top figure they have paid for any one player was €6.5m. They would need [...]
articles.title: When the player is the only danger

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC’S Scottish Cup Fifth Round tie against St Mirren in Paisley will be televised live with a 2pm kick-off on Sunday February 11. Satellite sports channel Viaplay will be beaming the action as it happens with the programme due to kick off at 1.30pm. Coincidentally, the holders met Stephen Robinson’s team EXACTLY a year ago [...]
articles.title: CELTIC AIM TO BE CUP SCREEN GEMS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ATLETICO MADRID are prepared to offer Celtic £20million for midfielder Matt O’Riley. The La Liga outfit played Brendan Rodgers’ side in the Champions League group stages earlier in the season and the elegant midfielder obviously caught the eye of Diego Simeone, according to a report in the Daily Mail. The ill-mannered Argentinian coach impressed no-one [...]
articles.title: £20m O’RILEY? ANOTHER INSULT FROM DEPLORABLE DIEGO

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: TONY MOWBRAY ended a lengthy pursuit of Zheng Zhi when he signed the Chinese international midfielder on a two-year deal at Celtic on September 5 2009. The recently-installed Hoops boss, who replaced Gordon Strachan, had tried to sign the 29-year-old playmaker for West Brom the previous season. Zheng was with Charlton at the time, but [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…ZHENG ZHI?

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC are poised to boot out a move from Atletico Madrid for Matt O’Riley. The champions have been informed of the interest from the Spanish outfit for their in-form midfielder, according to Sky Sports. It is understood the initial offer is a loan plus an obligation to buy the 23-year-old playmaker who cost the Hoops [...]
articles.title: WANTED MAN O’RILEY: CELTIC IN NO RUSH TO SELL

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: The leap from player to manager is difficult.  Talents which maintained your career on the field, like technique, fitness and an ability to follow team instructions, mean nothing.  Instead, you are required to support, develop and discipline players who work in a constant state of flux.  You need to understand and work within budgets, and [...]
articles.title: The leap to management. Nervy few days ahead

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MIKEY JOHNSTON is a transfer target for English Championship club West Brom. The Republic of Ireland international winger is in the sights of the promotion-chasing Midlands outfit, according to a report in the Daily Mail. Johnston is a peripheral figure in Brendan Rodgers’ first-team squad and the Hoops are unlikely to stand in the way [...]
articles.title: MIKEY JOHNSTON TARGETED

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC loan Bhoy Paulo Bernardo celebrates his 22nd birthday today. The gifted playmaker made a false start to his Hoops career after joining from Benfica on a season-long temporary deal in the summer. However, Bernardo has taken off with some eye-catching performances before the turn of the year, most notably his glittering display in the [...]
articles.title: ALL CHANGE FOR BIRTHDAY BHOY BERNARDO

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS has been told the exact time this month’s transfer window will close. The deadline has been moved FORWARD half-an-hour a week tonight with no more business allowed after 11.30pm as opposed to the traditional midnight cut-off. There will be no leeway for the Celtic manager as he seeks to strengthen his first-team squad with [...]
articles.title: RODGERS DISCOVERS DEADLINE D-DAY SWITCH

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MORTEN RASMUSSEN, bought by Tony Mowbray from Brondby in January 2010, cost Celtic a staggering £500,000 per goal. The 24-year-old Danish striker was purchased at £1.5million in an effort to inject some zest into the faltering Hoops attack – and he collected a measly three goals before being sold to his homeland club FC Midtjylland [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…MORTEN RASMUSSEN?

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LIEL ABADA is at the centre of a three-way transfer tug-of-war among English Championship sides Southampton, West Brom and Watford. The Israeli international winger is wanted on a loan switch until the end of the season, according to a report in the Daily Mail. Abada made his first start since September when he played in [...]
articles.title: ABADA IN LOAN ‘TRANSFER TUG-OF-WAR’

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: You would be forgiven if you didn’t know much about Kwon Hyeok-Kyu.  He joined Celtic in the summer from his hometown club in the Korean second tier but, before Saturday, the last football he played was July. Since then, the 22-year-old relocated to Scotland, with all the social, cultural, culinary and sporting challenges that involved.  [...]
articles.title: Kwon or mid-career journeymen

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: NEIL LENNON backed Brendan Rodgers for Premiership glory just one week after his countryman had returned to take over Celtic. The champions, under the guidance of Ange Postecoglou, lifted [...]
articles.title: LENNY DISMISSES IBROX TITLE HOPES

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC legend Scott Brown is poised for a dramatic return to the dug-out – with English fourth-tier strugglers Forest Green Rovers making a late move. articles.title: GREEN LIGHT FOR HOOPS LEGEND RETURN

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MAIK NAWROCKI admits he has no regrets following his £4.3million move to Celtic from Legia Warsaw in the summer. The 22-year-old central defender played the first three games – the Premiership wins over Saturday’s opponents Ross County (4-2) and Aberdeen (3-1) and 1-0 loss in the Viaplay League Cup loss at Kilmarnock – before dropping into [...]
articles.title: ‘I WAS ALWAYS CONFIDENT,’ INSISTS £4.3m MAIK

articles.description: CAMERON CARTER-VICKERS and Nicolas Kuhn are targeting special appearances against Ross County at Parkhead on Saturday. And [...]

articles.description: It was great to see Odin Holm return to action for the first time in two months yesterday.  Hopefully the player has now fully recovered from illness and can look forward to a period of development similar to that which Paulo Bernardo has enjoyed since last month. With a run of starts under his belt, [...]
articles.title: Bernardo beacon for Holm

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS admitted he was “really pleased” as Celtic eased back into action after the winter break with a 5-0 Scottish Cup romp over Buckie Thistle at storm-lashed Parkhead last night. However, the hard-to-please gaffer still saw room for improvement in the champions before they face Ross County in the east end of Glasgow in the [...]
articles.title: ‘WE NEEDED TO BE MORE AGGRESSIVE,’ INSISTS RODGERS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: PAULO BERNARDO admits he is “enjoying it a lot” as he displays some excellent form after a slow start to his season-long loan at Celtic. The Benfica playmaker scored the breakthrough goal for the third time in four games when he effortlessly chipped the ball into the Buckie Thistle net in the holders’ 5-0 Scottish Cup [...]

However, Beck was recalled to Anfield by Jurgen Klopp when regular No.3 Andy Robertson, the Scotland international skipper, and Greek back-up Kostas Tsimikas were [...]

articles.description:
Celtic are back and we kicked off with a win in Scottish Cup v Buckie Thistle. Brendan Rodgers is still looking to strengthen the squad and off load some of the players on the fringes of the squad. We have a League to win and Brendan’s comments on Matt O’Riley were welcome at today’s press […]
